news_header: A study reveals that explorer Christoffer Columbus was a Western European Sephardian based on DNA analysis.
news_text: The study aimed to clarify the origins of Christoffer Columbus, revealing through DNA analysis that he was a Western European Sephardian. This finding addresses long-standing disputes about his heritage and burial location, which is in the Cathedral of Seville. Columbus, who undertook voyages funded by Spain in the 1490s, played a crucial role in the European discovery of America. Sephardite Jews, from regions of Spain and Portugal, are part of the Jewish Diaspora.
